title: Description
description: Port cli.py + installer.py. clap-based CLI with subcommands: init, status, report, diagnostic, benchmark, compress, graph, history, plugins, version, ingest (new). Hook entry point: reads stdin JSON, runs Router, outputs to stdout. Init command generates keywords.json from .claude/ directory scan. Ingest command scans Claude Code session JSONL to bootstrap learner + predictor.

title: Description
description: Port context_router.py. The core Router struct with 8-phase update_attention pipeline: decay → keyword activation → learned boost → co-activation (petgraph BFS 2-hop) → pinned floor → demoted penalty → predictive pre-warm → cache stability sort. Plus build_context_output (HOT full content, WARM TOC headers, COLD evicted). Config loading from keywords.json + router_overrides.json.

title: Description
description: Port repo_map.py + outliner.py. Feature-gated behind `tree-sitter`. Tree-sitter AST parsing for Python, JS/TS, Go, Rust, Java, C/C++. Extract symbols (functions, classes, methods, imports). Build dependency graph from imports. PageRank via petgraph. Token-budgeted output (~50 tokens/file). Regex fallback when tree-sitter unavailable.

title: Rust rewrite of attnroute
description:
Full Rust rewrite of attnroute Python project. Cargo workspace with 8 crates: attentive-telemetry, attentive-core, attentive-learn, attentive-index, attentive-repo, attentive-compress, attentive-plugins, attentive (bin). Target sub-50ms hook execution. Includes git worktree support, history ingestion, and Reddit feedback fixes.

## Success Criteria
- cargo build --release produces single binary
- cargo test passes all unit + integration tests
- Hook execution < 50ms (criterion benchmark)
- State files compatible with Python attnroute JSON format
- All 8 attention pipeline phases ported
- 3 plugins ported (loopbreaker, verifyfirst, burnrate)
- attentive init / status / ingest CLI commands working
- Git worktree shared learned state

title: Init workspace skeleton + CI
description:
Create Cargo workspace with 8 crate stubs. Each crate has Cargo.toml with correct dependencies, lib.rs or main.rs, and compiles. Add .gitignore, rustfmt.toml. Workspace deps: serde, serde_json, chrono, thiserror, anyhow, tracing. Feature flags: tree-sitter, embeddings, claude-api, all.

## Acceptance Criteria
- cargo check --workspace passes
- cargo test --workspace passes
- All 8 crates compile

## Files
Cargo.toml (workspace root), crates/attentive/Cargo.toml+src/main.rs, crates/attentive-core/Cargo.toml+src/lib.rs, crates/attentive-learn/Cargo.toml+src/lib.rs, crates/attentive-index/Cargo.toml+src/lib.rs, crates/attentive-repo/Cargo.toml+src/lib.rs, crates/attentive-compress/Cargo.toml+src/lib.rs, crates/attentive-plugins/Cargo.toml+src/lib.rs, crates/attentive-telemetry/Cargo.toml+src/lib.rs, .gitignore, rustfmt.toml

title: Integration tests + Python state compatibility
description:
E2E integration tests. Full routing pipeline cold start through 5 turns. Python state file compat: load Python-generated attn_state.json, learned_state.json, keywords.json. Criterion benchmarks p99 < 50ms.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Cold start produces valid output
- 5-turn sequence shows decay + activation
- Python attn_state.json loads into Rust
- Python learned_state.json loads into Rust
- Benchmark p99 < 50ms

## Reference
/private/tmp/attnroute/tests/

title: attentive-telemetry: shared types and paths
description:
Port telemetry_lib.py + telemetry_record.py + telemetry_report.py. Core shared types: Paths (with git worktree detection via git rev-parse --git-common-dir), TurnRecord, AttentionHistoryEntry, estimate_tokens(), ContentType enum, JSONL read/write, atomic file writes (temp+rename). Paths resolves ~/.claude, project .claude, worktree common dir.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Paths resolves ~/.claude, project .claude, worktree common dir
- TurnRecord round-trips through serde_json
- estimate_tokens matches Python within 10%
- Atomic write uses temp+rename pattern
- JSONL append + read back works

## Reference
/private/tmp/attnroute/attnroute/telemetry_lib.py, telemetry_record.py, telemetry_report.py

title: attentive-core: 8-phase attention engine
description:
Port context_router.py. Router struct with 8-phase update_attention: decay, keyword activation (compiled regex), learned boost, co-activation (petgraph BFS 2-hop, 0.35 direct + 0.15 transitive), pinned floor, demoted penalty, predictive pre-warm, cache stability sort. Plus build_context_output (HOT full content max 3, WARM TOC headers max 5, COLD evicted, 20K char limit). Config from keywords.json + router_overrides.json. Notification stripping.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Decay reduces scores by category rate
- Keyword match sets score to 1.0
- Co-activation boosts related 0.35, transitive 0.15
- Pinned files >= WARM threshold
- Max 3 HOT, 5 WARM, 20K chars enforced
- Cache stability: pinned first, streak, score
- State round-trip compatible with Python attn_state.json
- Notification XML stripped before matching

## Reference
/private/tmp/attnroute/attnroute/context_router.py

title: attentive-plugins: trait + 3 builtins
description:
Port plugins/base.py + loopbreaker + verifyfirst + burnrate. Plugin trait: on_session_start, on_prompt_pre, on_prompt_post, on_stop. PluginRegistry loads from config.json. LoopBreaker: 3+ similar signatures (0.7 similarity), injects strategy change. VerifyFirst: read-before-write enforcement. BurnRate: rolling burn rate from stats-cache.json, warns at 30min/10min thresholds.

## Acceptance Criteria
- LoopBreaker detects loop after 3 similar attempts
- VerifyFirst flags write without prior read
- BurnRate warns at threshold
- Plugin state persists to JSON, events to JSONL
- Enable/disable via config.json

## Reference
/private/tmp/attnroute/attnroute/plugins/

title: attentive-learn: learner + predictor + oracle
description:
Port learner.py + predictor.py + oracle.py. Learner: prompt-file affinity (IDF-weighted), co-activation (Jaccard>=0.25), file rhythms, session warm-start, usefulness scoring. Maturity: observing 0-24 turns (no boost) -> active 25+ (0.35 weight). Predictor: dual-mode confident (file mentions, strong keywords, Markov) + fallback (recency, co-occurrence, popularity). JSON persistence not pickle. Oracle: task type classification + cost prediction.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Observing mode applies zero boost
- Active mode applies 0.35-weighted boost
- IDF dampens common words
- Predictor finds file mentions in prompt
- Model serializes to JSON round-trip
- Oracle classifies task types

## Reference
/private/tmp/attnroute/attnroute/learner.py, predictor.py, oracle.py

title: attentive-index: BM25 + SQLite search
description:
Port indexer.py. Hand-rolled BM25 (k1=1.5, b=0.75). SQLite storage with FTS5. Optional ONNX embeddings behind embeddings feature (fusion 0.6*bm25 + 0.4*cosine). SimpleTfIdf fallback. Incremental mtime-based updates.

## Acceptance Criteria
- BM25 ranks relevant docs higher
- Empty corpus handled gracefully
- FTS5 search returns matches
- Incremental update only reindexes changed files
- Top-k sorted by relevance

## Reference
/private/tmp/attnroute/attnroute/indexer.py

title: attentive-repo: tree-sitter + PageRank
description:
Port repo_map.py + outliner.py. Feature-gated tree-sitter. AST parsing for Python, JS/TS, Go, Rust, Java, C/C++. Symbol extraction (functions, classes, methods, imports). Dependency graph from imports. PageRank via petgraph. Token-budgeted output ~50 tokens/file. Regex fallback.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Parse Python extracts functions and classes
- Dependency graph has correct edges
- PageRank ranks imported files higher
- Token budget respected
- Regex fallback produces output without tree-sitter

## Reference
/private/tmp/attnroute/attnroute/repo_map.py, outliner.py

title: attentive-compress: memory compression
description:
Port compressor.py. Feature-gated claude-api. SQLite storage for compressed observations. 3-layer progressive retrieval (index, timeline, full). Claude API compression via reqwest+tokio. Fallback extractive compression without API. FTS5 search.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Fallback compression extracts key sentences
- Observation round-trips through SQLite
- Progressive retriever returns correct layers
- FTS5 search finds relevant observations

## Reference
/private/tmp/attnroute/attnroute/compressor.py

title: attentive binary: CLI + hook entry + ingest
description:
Port cli.py + installer.py. clap CLI: init, status, report, diagnostic, benchmark, compress, graph, history, plugins, version, ingest (new). Hook entry: stdin JSON -> Router -> stdout. Init generates keywords.json from .claude/ scan. Ingest scans Claude Code session JSONL to bootstrap learner+predictor. No ghost attnroute-setup command.

## Acceptance Criteria
- attentive init creates keywords.json
- attentive status shows config
- attentive version prints version
- Hook reads stdin JSON, produces tiered output
- attentive ingest reads session JSONL

title: Description
description: In Paths, detect git worktrees via `git rev-parse --git-common-dir`. Place learned_state.json and predictor_model.json in common git dir (shared across worktrees). attn_state.json stays per-worktree (session-local). Keywords.json resolved per-worktree first, falls back to common.

title: Description
description: Port plugins/base.py + loopbreaker.py + verifyfirst.py + burnrate.py. Plugin trait with on_session_start, on_prompt_pre, on_prompt_post, on_stop hooks. PluginRegistry loads enabled plugins from config.json. Each plugin persists state to JSON, events to JSONL.
